fields.description:
In case of more than one security groups displayed on the launch config pages, there should be more clear, visual indication on the existence of the multiple security groups. See the attachment.

The first tile holds two sgroups, [vic, default]
fields.summary: The launch configs landing page doesn't list all security groups

comments.body: The same issue exists for the launch group detail page.
I found how the multiple security groups display was handled in the instance pages. Will copy the style.

The fix is included in the pull request:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/296

I verified that only the first security group's sg number, not name, shows in tile view.
Screenshots of the launch config in tile view and its detail page are attached.
Instead of the sg number, we should display security group name.
[~jloza] in case of launch config created with multiple security groups, should all security groups be displayed in the tile view?

This is not a critical issue for 4.0.
Multiple security groups should be displayed in a manner consistent with the way they are displayed for instances. Thanks, y'all!

[~jloza], [~alice]: Fixed in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/763 which is consistent with the AWS Management Console.  Note that, unlike security groups for an instance, the AWS API calls only returns security group ids, not names, for the groups attached to a launch config.
[~kyolee]: The Jenkins build for PR 763 seems to be failing immediately.  Could you investigate?
[~kyolee]: I've re-triggered the Jenkins build and it appears to be in progress now at http://10.111.4.12/job/Eucalyptus%20Console%20Pull%20Request%20Monitor/307/

[~kgill] how do we display multiple security groups for instances? I want to be sure we are consistent with **ourselves** rather than with AWS console, since we strive to provide a better user experience than they do.

[~jloza]: The API call to fetch the security groups for an instance returns the security group id *and* name, while the API call for the launch configs only returns the id, so we can't be consistent across the two types without additional API calls for the launch config landing page.  We had implemented API calls to pull in the security group names on the launch configs landing page, but it causes the landing page to take far too long to load (see GUI-822), so we had to revert that approach.
[~kyolee] Pull request 763 is ready for review
[~kgill] As seen in the attachment above, on AWS, some security groups are displayed with the IDs only.
[~kyolee]: We can't pull names for those security groups due to GUI-832, so this is the best we can do for now.
[~kgill] Ok, then. Will merge the fix.

The fix has been merged.

As commented above, on AWS, VPC security group will be displayed with their IDs only.

[~kyolee]: I retested this in both Eucalyptus and AWS and I did not see a difference.  I only saw one security group name on the LC launch page even though multiple existed and I did not see group IDs.  I will attach screen shots.  I was running build: 4.0.0-0.0.468.20140606gitc323a3aa
[~jloza] could you please confirm if this is the UX you agreed on?
